perturbation.original_text:
5.5   All management decisions of the JVC shall require the simple majority vote of the Board either at a meeting of the Board or by resolution
passed by circulation subject to the provisions of the Article 5.6 Meetings of the Board shall take place in Delhi or such other place as may be
decided by the Board. For calling a Board meeting, a notice of at least fourteen [14 ] days in advance in writing shall be given to each of the
Directors, including those outside India. However, a meeting of Directors may be called by giving a shorter notice provided it is mutually
agreed by the Directors. Subject to the provisions of the Act, a resolution circulated and signed by all Directors shall be effective, as a
resolution duly passed at a meeting of Directors. Sitting fees, travel and stay expenses (incurred by the Directors) for attending the Board
meeting, if claimed by the Director(s) shall be met by the JVC as per Articles of Association of the JVC.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.5   All management decisions of the JVC shall require the simple majority vote of the Board either at a meeting of the Board or by resolution
passed by circulation subject to the provisions of the Article 5.6 Meetings of the Board shall take place in Delhi or such other place as may be
decided by the Board. For calling a Board meeting, a notice of at least five [5] business days in advance in writing shall be given to each of the Directors, including those outside India. However, a meeting of Directors may be called by giving a shorter notice of 24 hours provided it is approved by IMPCO. Subject to the provisions of the Act, a resolution circulated and signed by all Directors shall be effective, as a
resolution duly passed at a meeting of Directors. Sitting fees, travel and stay expenses (incurred by the Directors) for attending the Board
meeting, if claimed by the Director(s) shall be met by the JVC as per Articles of Association of the JVC.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by initially requiring a fourteen [14] day notice period for board meetings, but then allows for a shorter notice of 24 hours if approved by IMPCO. The original text requires the Directors to agree, making enforcement uncertain and creating potential for disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
9.2   Subject to the agreement of the Parties, the JVC may export the Products. Such export shall be through IMPCO. The Parties agree that any
direct export of the Products would only be with the prior written consent of IMPCO. IMPCO agrees that they may consider sourcing the
Products from the JVC for their Asia-Pacific operations.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.2   Subject to the agreement of the Parties, the JVC may export the Products. Such export shall be through IMPCO for the first two years. The Parties agree that any direct export of the Products would only be with the prior written consent of MIL/MINDA after the initial two years. IMPCO agrees that they may consider sourcing the Products from the JVC for their Asia-Pacific operations.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by initially stating that all exports shall be through IMPCO and then saying any direct exports would only need the consent of MIL/MINDA after two years. The contradictory statement causes uncertainty about which party has the authority to approve direct exports.

perturbation.original_text:
16.1   This Agreement shall become effective on the date of execution and shall continue in force and effect for an indefinite term thereafter unless
terminated pursuant to the provisions of Article 16 or by all the Parties in writing.
perturbation.changed_text: 16.1   This Agreement shall become effective on the date of execution and shall continue in force and effect for an indefinite term thereafter unless terminated pursuant to the provisions of Article 16 or by a written notice from IMPCO.
perturbation.explanation: This edit introduces an in-text contradiction regarding the agreement's termination. The original text stipulates the agreement can be terminated pursuant to Article 16 or by all parties in writing. The revised text states that termination can occur pursuant to Article 16 or by written notice from IMPCO. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding the grounds and authority required for terminating the agreement.
